e:
LESSON 22
It is very important to read the theory lessons if you want to pass the real exam from the first time. The practice questions for the theory lessons are with voice.

e:
LESSON 22
It is very important to read the theory lessons if you want to pass the real exam from the first time. The practice questions for the theory lessons are with voice.

e:
LESSON 22
It is very important to read the theory lessons if you want to pass the real exam from the first time. The practice questions for the theory lessons are with voice.

LESSON 22
It is very important to read the theory lessons if you want to pass the real exam from the first time. The practice questions for the theory lessons are with voice.

It is very important to read the theory lessons if you want to pass the real exam from the first time. The practice questions for the theory lessons are with voice.

LESSON 22

e:
LESSON 22
It is very important to read the theory lessons if you want to pass the real exam from the first time. The practice questions for the theory lessons are with voice.

e:
LESSON 22
It is very important to read the theory lessons if you want to pass the real exam from the first time. The practice questions for the theory lessons are with voice.

e:
LESSON 22
It is very important to read the theory lessons if you want to pass the real exam from the first time. The practice questions for the theory lessons are with voice.

A level crossing with barriers and lights. But the lights are out.

LESSON 22

e:
LESSON 22
It is very important to read the theory lessons if you want to pass the real exam from the first time. The practice questions for the theory lessons are with voice.

e:
LESSON 22
It is very important to read the theory lessons if you want to pass the real exam from the first time. The practice questions for the theory lessons are with voice.

q:
*** 5 points question ***

You hear the warning bell sound, but the barriers are still completely open.

A. You are allowed to drive through.
B. You must stop.
e:
[Violations of the 3th and 4th degree on our page Theory B: nr. 32]
LESSON 22
It is very important to read the theory lessons if you want to pass the real exam from the first time. The practice questions for the theory lessons are with voice.

q:
*** 5 points question ***

Are you allowed to come out of this street with a car?
e:
[Violations of the 3th and 4th degree on our page Theory B: nr. 32]
LESSON 23
It is very important to read the theory lessons if you want to pass the real exam from the first time. The practice questions for the theory lessons are with voice.

q: Are you allowed to drive past these signs to visit a relative who lives in this street?
e:
LESSON 23
It is very important to read the theory lessons if you want to pass the real exam from the first time. The practice questions for the theory lessons are with voice.

q: Are you allowed to drive past this sign with a car?
e:
LESSON 23
It is very important to read the theory lessons if you want to pass the real exam from the first time. The practice questions for the theory lessons are with voice.

q:
You are not allowed to drive past this sign with a car.
But are you allowed to come out of this street with your car?
e:
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
This prohibitive sign indicates no entry past this sign to drivers of all vehicles having more than two wheels or motorcycles with a side car.

q:
*** 5 points question ***

Is the blue car allowed to turn right?
e:
[Violations of the 3th and 4th degree on our page Theory B: nr. 32]
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
This prohibitive sign indicates no entry to any driver (including cyclists) to drive past this sign in this direction.

q: Are you allowed to drive past this sign with a car?
e:
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
This positive instruction sign means: no through road.

q:
*** 5 points question ***

What does this sign indicate?

A. The M.G.W.
B. The M.A.W.
e:
[Violations of the 3th and 4th degree on our page Theory B: nr. 32]
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
Tip exam: learn very well in your book (chapter 9) the difference between M.A.W. and M.G.W.

q:
When is it permitted to drive on this road marking?

A. Never.
B. In order to reach your property.
C. In order to reach your property or to turn at a junction.
e:
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
This is a traffic displacement area (see rule in your book chapter 2).

q:
Who is allowed to ride out of this street?

A. Only mopeds and bicycles.
B. All kinds of vehicles.
C. No one.
e:
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
This sign prohibits drivers of motor vehicles with more than two wheels and all motorcycles to drive past this sign.
However they are allowed to drive in the opposite direction.

q:
What does this traffic sign mean?

A. No oncoming traffic.
B. From here until the next junction no U-turn.
C. No left turn.
e:
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
This sign indicates that form this sign on until the next junction (also there) a U turn is prohibited.

q:
*** 5 points question ***

Are you allowed to drive past this sign with a car?
e:
[Violations of the 3th and 4th degree on our page Theory B: nr. 32]
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
This prohibitive sign indicates no entry to any driver, with the exception of cyclists, pedelecs and mopeds class A to drive past this sign in this direction.

q:
*** 5 points question ***

Are all passenger cars allowed to drive past this sign?
e:
[Violations of the 3th and 4th degree on our page Theory B: nr. 32]
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
Only cars with a maximum gross weight of 2,5 ton.

q:
You’re without gas and your garage is at the beginning of the street on the right.
Are you allowed to push your car to the right?

A. No, because you are still a driver.
B. Yes, because then you are a pedestrian.
e:
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
If you push your car, you are still a driver.
This sign indicates that turning to the right lane is prohibited at the next junction to all drivers.

q:
What is the maximum speed limit for a car passing these signs?

A. 50 kph.
B. 90 kph.
C. A car isn’t allowed to drive past these signs.
e:
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
Up to 50 km/hour.

q:
This sign applies …

A. ... only to lorries/trucks.
B. ... to all kinds of vehicles.
e:
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
No entry to vehicles or combination of vehicles which load included, exceed the length shown.
(See in your book also lesson 10).

q: Are you allowed to drive past these signs with a car?
e:
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
This prohibitive sign indicates no entry to any driver (including cyclists) to drive past this sign in this direction.

q: Is the brown car allowed to come out of the street?
e:
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
This prohibitive sign indicates no entry past this sign to drivers of all vehicles having more than two wheels or motorcycles with a side car.
However they are allowed to drive in the opposite direction.

q: Is a cyclist allowed to ride past this sign?
e:
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
This sign means: no entry in both directions to any driver.

q: Is the blue car allowed to cross the junction?
e:
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
This sign means: no entry in this direction to drivers of motorcycles.

q:
*** 5 points question ***

This sign indicates …

A. ... the M.A.W. (Maximum Authorized Weight).
B. ... the M.G.W. (Maximum Gross Weight).
e:
[Violations of the 3th and 4th degree on our page Theory B: nr. 32]
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
Tip exam: learn very well in your book (chapter 9) the difference between M.A.W. and M.G.W.

q:
You are not allowed to drive past these signs with a car, of course.
But are you allowed to come out of the street with a car?
e:
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
This sign means: no entry in both directions to any driver, except cyclists and pedelecs.

q: Are you allowed to drive past this sign with a car?
e:
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
A regular passenger car has a M.A.W. up to 3.5 tons.

q:
The driver of this car is allowed …

A. ... to turn left.
B. ... to turn right.
C. ... to drive straight through.
e:
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
This sign indicates that turning to the left is prohibited at the next junction to all drivers.

q:
*** 5 points question ***

Is a car allowed to drive past this sign?
e:
[Violations of the 3th and 4th degree on our page Theory B: nr. 32]
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
Tip exam: learn very well in your book (chapter 9) the difference between M.A.W. and M.G.W.

q: Once you are past this traffic sign you are allowed to make a U-turn again.
e:
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
This sign indicates that form this sign on until the next junction (also there) a U turn is prohibited.

q: Are you allowed to drive past this sign to park your car?
e:
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
This prohibitive sign indicates no entry to any driver (including cyclists) to drive past this sign in this direction.

q:
You’re out of gas.
Which vehicle are you allowed to push into the street on the right to refuel?

A. Only a two-wheeled moped.
B. A two-wheeled moped or a motorcycle.
C. No moped and no motorcycle.
e:
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
Someone who pushes a moped is a pedestrian.
Someone who pushes a motorcycle is a driver.

q:
You approach this junction with your car.

A. You are allowed to turn right.
B. You are allowed to cross the junction.
C. You must take a U-turn.
e:
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
This prohibitive sign indicates no entry to any driver (including cyclists) to drive past this sign in this direction.

q: Is oncoming traffic from the other direction possible?
e:
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
This prohibitive sign indicates no entry to any driver (including cyclists) to drive past this sign in this direction.

q: This road is a short cut to your workplace. Are you allowed to drive on?
e:
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
This sign means: no entry in both directions to any driver.

q: Is the driver of car A allowed to turn right at the junction?
e:
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
This sign indicates that turning to the right is prohibited at the next junction to all drivers.

q:
In what direction must you drive your car?

A. Direction A.
B. Direction B.
C. Direction A or B.
e:
LESSON 24 – ‘Obligatory direction’.
The arrow indicates that you have to drive to the right.

q:
The blue car …

A. ... must drive straight through.
B. ... must turn left.
C. ... is allowed to turn left or drive straight through.
e:
LESSON 24 – ‘Obligatory direction’.
The sign next to the car says that the driver must drive straight through.

q:
This car ...

A. ... is allowed to turn left or right.
B. ... must turn right.
e:
LESSON 24 – ‘Obligatory direction’.
The blue sign says the driver must turn to the right.

q: Is the brown car allowed to turn left?
e:
LESSON 24 – ‘Obligatory direction’.
The brown car may turn to the right or to the left or straight on.

q:
Which sign indicates a one way street?

A. Sign 1.
B. Sign 2.
e:
LESSON 24 – ‘Obligatory direction’.
Sign 1: Road with one-way traffic.
Sign 2. Driver has to follow that direction of travel.

q:
The driver of the brown car is allowed to …

A. turn left only.
B. turn right only.
C. turn left or right.
e:
LESSON 24 – ‘Obligatory direction’.
The driver may turn to both directions.

q:
There is no roundabout.
Are you allowed to drive with a car in the direction of the arrow past the obstacle?
e:
LESSON 24 – ‘Obligatory direction’.
No, you have to pass the obstacle right.

q:
Who has priority at this junction?

A. The brown car.
B. The blue car.
e:
LESSON 24 – ‘Obligatory direction’.
The blue car has priority from the right.

q: You are allowed to pass this bollard to the left or to the right?
e:
LESSON 24 – ‘Obligatory direction’.
The board indicates that you should drive along the left or along the right.

q:
Who has priority?

A. The brown car.
B. The blue car.
e:
LESSON 24 – ‘Obligatory direction’.
The brown car has priority from the right.

q: Is the blue car allowed to turn left at this junction?
e:
LESSON 24 – ‘Obligatory direction’.
The blue sign says it's a one-way street.

q:
Which of these signs is an information sign?

A. Only sign 1.
B. Only sign 2.
C. Sign 1 and sign 2.
e:
LESSON 24 – ‘Obligatory direction’.
Sign 1: road with one-way traffic.
Sign 2: required to follow direction of travel.

q: Is the red car allowed to turn right?
e:
LESSON 24 – ‘Obligatory direction’.
There is no sign that it is forbidden.

q:
Beyond which board a car is allowed to turn right?

A. Board 1.
B. Board 2.
e:
LESSON 24 – ‘Obligatory direction’.
On a road with one-way traffic you will not see oncoming traffic, except as a charger plate it indicates.

q:
What is the driver of the blue car not allowed to do?

A. Drive straight through.
B. Turn right.
C. Turn left.
e:
LESSON 24 – ‘Obligatory direction’.
The blue sign says he must go straight ahead or turn to the left.

q: Is the driver of the grey car allowed to cross these road markings to reach his apartment?
e:
LESSON 24 – ‘Obligatory direction’.
You may not drive on a traffic displacement area.

q: Is the driver of the blue car allowed to cross the junction?
e:
LESSON 24 – ‘Obligatory direction’.
The red sign says that it is forbidden to drive past the sign in that direction.

q: In the middle of the picture you see a roundabout.
e:
LESSON 24 – ‘Obligatory direction’.
There is no sign indicating that it is a roundabout.
It is a traffic guide.

q:
This picture is taken from the car you drive in.

A. You are only allowed to turn left.
B. You are only allowed to turn right.
C. You are allowed to turn left or right.
e:
LESSON 24 – ‘Obligatory direction’.
You may drive in both directions.

q: Do these signs have the same meaning?
e:
LESSON 24 – ‘Obligatory direction’.
They have the same meaning.

q:
The driver of this car has stopped at a house to ask for directions.

A. The car is waiting.
B. The car is parked.
e:
LESSON 25 – ‘Waiting and parking’.
Parking: if you stop for a longer time than strictly necessary to allow passengers in or out or to load or unload goods, than in terms of traffic regulations this is a vehicle that is parked.

q:
Within a built up area.
Is a car allowed to park on that part of the public road marked with the yellow line?
e:
LESSON 25 – ‘Waiting and parking’.
In built-up areas: only on the ground level verge.

q:
What are you allowed to do on the left of this road?

A. Only being stationary.
B. Being stationary and park.
C. Not being stationary or park.
e:
LESSON 25 – ‘Waiting and parking’.
On a road with one-way traffic you may wait and park on both sides.

q:
What is prohibited under this bridge or a tunnel?

A. Park on the road and on the verge.
B. Being stationary and park on the road and on the verge.
C. Being stationary and park on the road.
e:
LESSON 25 – ‘Waiting and parking’.
You are not allowed to wait or park on the road.

q: You are not allowed to park or to be stationary on the road within (…) meters in front of a crossing for cyclists or two-wheeled mopeds.
e:
LESSON 25 – ‘Waiting and parking’.
You are not allowed to be stationary or park on the road within 5 meters of a crossing for pedestrians or cyclists.

q:
What are the cars allowed to do on this marking?

A. To be stationary.
B. To be stationary and park.
C. Not being stationary or parking.
e:
LESSON 25 – ‘Waiting and parking’.
The cars should not stand there.

q: Are you allowed to be stationary on the cycle lane to let someone in or out of the car?
e:
LESSON 25 – ‘Waiting and parking’.
The bicycle lane is not part of the roadway.
You may not ride, being stationary or park on a bicycle lane.

q:
A junction with traffic lights.
You are not allowed to be stationary or to park on the road or on the verge within (…) meters in front of the traffic lights.
e:
LESSON 25 – ‘Waiting and parking’.
You are not allowed to be stationary or to park on the road and on the verge at a junction with traffic lights within 20 meters of the traffic lights.

q:
You are tired of sitting in the car and you stop for a while on the breakdown lane to stretch your legs.
Is this allowed?
e:
LESSON 25 – ‘Waiting and parking’.
You may only stop there in the event of a breakdown or an accident.

q:
The cycle lane stops and the cyclists have to ride on the road.

A. You are not allowed to park on the road within 5 meters in front of that place.
B. You are not allowed to park or to be stationary on the road and on the verge within 5 meters in front of that place.
C. You are not allowed to park or to be stationary on the road and on the verge within 5 meters in front of or past that place.
e:
LESSON 25 – ‘Waiting and parking’.
When the cycle lane stops, up to 5 meters in front of and beyond the place where they come on the roadway.

q:
This driver is reversing in order to park.

A. He doesn’t have to wear a seat belt.
B. He must wear a seat belt.
e:
LESSON 25 – ‘Waiting and parking’.
During reversing you don’t have to wear a belt.

q:
You are not allowed to park or wait on a pedestrian crossing.
But is it allowed on the verge?
e:
LESSON 25 – ‘Waiting and parking’.
ON the crossing for pedestrians and cyclists you are not allowed to wait and park on the road and on the verge.

q:
The red car is not allowed to park in this bend.
Is the driver allowed to wait to let someone out of the car?
e:
LESSON 25 – ‘Waiting and parking’.
You are not allowed to wait or park on the road in or in front of a blind corner.

q: Between two parked cars there has to be (…) meters  free space.
e:
LESSON 25 – ‘Waiting and parking’.
When you park on the road, you have to leave at least 1 meter free space between two parked cars.

q:
The lane next to the solid white line is meant to park or to be stationary.
Are you allowed to use this lane to pass or overtake a car on the right more easily?
e:
LESSON 25 – ‘Waiting and parking’.
Some roads have a white solid line painted at the right of that lane. You are only allowed to park or to be stationary next to it.

q:
You are not allowed to park or to be stationary on the lanes of a motorway.
But you are allowed on an express way?

A. Correct.
B. Incorrect.
e: LESSON 25 – ‘Waiting and parking’.

q: There has been an accident in the other direction. Are you allowed to stop on the breakdown lane to provide assistance.
e: Explanation: See Lesson 25

q:
You are not allowed to park or to be stationary on a cycle lane.
Are you allowed to drive on the cycle lane to pass another vehicle more safely?
e: Explanation: See Lesson 25

q: You are not allowed to park or to be stationary within (…) meters in front of the junction.
e: Explanation: See Lesson 25

q:
This sign is 1.20 meter high.
Your car is lower than 1.65 meter.

You are not allowed to park or to be stationary within (...) meters in front of this sign.
e: Explanation: See Lesson 25

q:

The rear fog light …

A. ... must be lit.
B. ... is allowed to be lit.
C. ... is not allowed to be lit.
e: Explanation: See Lesson 25

q:
What is the car allowed to do here?

A. Only to be stationary.
B. To be stationary and to park.
C. Not being stationary or parking.
e: Explanation: See Lesson 25

q:

A. Only within a built up area.
B. Only outside a built up area.
C. Within or outside a built up area.
e: Explanation: See Lesson 25

q:
On a suggested cycle lane you are …

A. only allowed to be stationary.
B. allowed to be stationary or to park.
C. not allowed to be stationary or to park.
e: Explanation: See Lesson 25

q:
On the question mark a car is allowed to …

A. ... to be stationary.
B. ... to be stationary or to park.
C. ... is not allowed to be stationary or to park.
e: Explanation: See Lesson 25

q:
Is the driver of the blue car allowed to be stationary for a moment to let a passenger out of the car?

A. No.
B. Yes.
C. Yes, when he doesn’t hinder other drivers.
e: Explanation: See Lesson 25

q:
This picture is taken within a built up area.

A. No, he isn’t.
B. Yes, he is.
C. Yes, he must.
e: Explanation: See Lesson 25

q: Within (...) meters in front of these traffic signs you are not allowed to park on the road or on the verge.
e: Explanation: See Lesson 25

q: You are not allowed to park within (…) meters in front of this pedestrian crossing?
e: Explanation: See Lesson 25

q:
A junction without traffic lights or traffic signs.
You are not allowed to park on the road or on the verge within 5 meters of the intersection with the edge of the transverse road.

e: Explanation: See Lesson 25

C. ... not allowed to be stationary or park.

C. Arrow 3.
e: Explanation: See lesson 26

e: Explanation: See lesson 26

q:
You are allowed to be stationary on a priority road …

A. ... within a built up area.
B. ... outside a built up area.
C. ... within or outside a built up area.
e: Explanation: See lesson 26

A. allowed to be stationary or park.
B. allowed to be stationary.
C. not allowed to be stationary or park.
e: Explanation: See lesson 26

A. ... only on the road.
B. ... on the road and on the verge.
e: Explanation: See lesson 26

q: Is the blue car allowed to park there?
e: Explanation: See lesson 26

e: Explanation: See lesson 26

B. ... allowed to be stationary or to park.
C. ... not allowed to be stationary or to park.
e: Explanation: See lesson 26

q: You are not allowed to park within (...) meters in front and past the bus stop sign.
e: Explanation: See lesson 26

q:
Is this correct?
Past these signs you are not allowed to be stationary or to park on the road or on the verge.
e: Explanation: See lesson 26

q:
Within a built-up area.
Is the car allowed to park on this priority road?
e:
LESSON 26
Within a built-up area, a car may park on the roadway.
Outside a built-up area, a car must park on the shoulder.

q:
It is the 26th March.
Are you allowed to park in front of these signs?
e: Explanation: See lesson 26

q:

You are not allowed to park or to be stationary within 5 meters in front or past the place where the cyclists have to use the road.

A. Correct.

e: Explanation: See lesson 26

B. Only the second sign.

e: Explanation: See lesson 26

e: Explanation: See lesson 26

q: Is the car allowed to park on this priority road?

q:
To check the oil level, the car must be on a flat surface.
But when should you check the oil level?

A. When the engine is cold.
B. After driving a few kilometres so the oil is warm.
e:
LESSON 31
Engine oil is one of the most important fluids in your vehicle. It lubricates moving parts, prevents overheating and wear, and helps keep the engine clean.
To get a reliable reading, you should check the oil level when the engine is cold and the car is parked on a level surface. If the oil is still warm, it may not have fully drained back into the oil pan, leading to an inaccurate reading.

e:
LESSON 24 – ‘Obligatory direction’.
If you're driving on a one-way road, you should also grant priority, except of course when there is a traffic sign indicating you have priority.
In this example, the brown car may drive first.

q:
If you see this is under plate, it also applies to speed pedelecs.

A. Correct.
B. Fault.
e:
LESSON 24 – ‘Obligatory direction’.
It also applies to pedelecs (P) but not to mopeds class A.

q:
This white underside applies to:

A. Bicycles only.
B. Bicycles and speed pedelecs only.
C. Bicycles, mopeds class A and speed pedelecs.
e:
LESSON 24 – ‘Obligatory direction’.
If the letter P is mentioned, it also applies to speed pedelecs.
If the letters P and A are mentioned, it also applies to speed pedelecs and mopeds class A.

q:
This white underside applies to:

A. Bicycles only.
B. Bicycles and pedelecs only.
C. Bicycles, mopeds class A and pedelecs.
e:
LESSON 24 – ‘Obligatory direction’.
If the letter P is mentioned, it also applies to pedelcs.
If the letters P and A are mentioned, it also applies to pedelecs and mopeds class A.

q:
Which vehicles can come from the other direction?

A. None.
B. Bicycles and pedelecs only.
C. Bicycles, pedelecs and mopeds class A.
e:
LESSON 24 – ‘Obligatory direction’.
If the letter P is mentioned, it also applies to pedelcs.
If the letters P and A are mentioned, it also applies to pedelecs and mopeds class A.

q:
What does this traffic sign indicate?

A. No entry for drivers of motor vehicles with four wheels and quads.
B. No entry for drivers of quads.
C. No entry for drivers of quads and motorcyclists.
e:
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
No entry for drivers of quads.

q:
If you see this is under plate, it also applies to speed pedelecs.

A. Correct.
B. Fault.
e:
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
Speed Pedelecs are mopeds.

q:
Which vehicles can drive past this board?

A. Bicycles only.
B. Bicycles and pedelecs only.
C. Bicycles, mopeds class A and pedelecs.
e:
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
If the letter P is mentioned, it also applies to pedelcs.
If the letters P and A are mentioned, it also applies to pedelecs and mopeds class A.

q:
Which vehicles can drive past this board?

A. Bicycles only.
B. Bicycles and pedelecs only.
C. Bicycles, mopeds class A and pedelecs.
e:
LESSON 23 – ‘Prohibited direction’.
If the letter P is mentioned, it also applies to pedelcs.
If the letters P and A are mentioned, it also applies to pedelecs and mopeds class A.

q:
On a highway, only a towing service that has been called by the police can tow a car.
What happens on an express road?

A. You may ask a friend to tow your car.
B. A towing service that you call can tow.
C. The police will request a towing service.
e:
LESSON 5 – ‘The express road’.
If your car breaks down on a highway or an express road, the police call a towing service they prefer.

q:
The brown car driver wants to turn left.
May he drive onto the intersection?

A. Yes, because the light is green.
B. No, because the intersection is not free.
e:
LESSON 18 – ‘Traffic lights’.
Although the light is green, the driver of the brown car must not drive the intersection yet. He has to wait until the intersection is free.

q:
This traffic light for a tram has the same meaning as ...

A. ... a red light.
B. ... a green light.
C. ... an orange yellow light.
e: LESSON 18 – ‘Traffic lights’.

q:
This traffic light for a tram means:

A. Only straight ahead driving.
B. In every direction you can drive on.
C. Stop.
e:
LESSON 18 – ‘Traffic lights’.
Just straight ahead.

q:
This traffic light for a tram has the same meaning as ...

A. ... a red light.
B. ... a green light.
C. ... an orange yellow light.
e:
LESSON 18 – ‘Traffic lights’.
An inverted triangle has the same meaning as a green traffic light.

q:
You're waiting in your car when the traffic light is red.
May you constantly give some gas to keep warm the engine?
e:
LESSON 18 – ‘Traffic lights’.
Gently give gas while you wait (broum ... broum ... broum ...) may not.

q:
What does the white / yellow flashing light mean in the middle of the lights for a tram?

A. Tram must be driven very slowly due to a possible defect on the tracks.
B. You may cross the light with double caution, with due observance of the prevailing priority rules.
e:
LESSON 18 – ‘Traffic lights’.
Important: double caution and compliance with the priority rules.

q:
The traffic lights are defective. Who has priority?

A. The green car.
B. The blue car.
e:
LESSON 18 – ‘Traffic lights’.
If the traffic lights are defective, then the usual priority rules apply.
There are no signs under the lights that control the priority, so priority from the right.

q:
The traffic light is green, but the crossroads are not yet free.
May you stay on the zebra crossing while waiting for the intersection to be free?
e:
LESSON 18 – ‘Traffic lights’.
You must not cross the crossroads unless the light is green and the crossroads are free. But you cannot block the crossing point while waiting.

q:
*** 5 points question ***

Can you send a text while waiting in the car for a red light?
e:
[Violations of the 3th and 4th degree on our page Theory B: nr. 32]
LESSON 18 – ‘Traffic lights’.
That is prohibited.

q:
The round traffic light is green and you want to turn left. But the evacuation arrow is not burning yet.
Can you cross the crossroads?
e:
LESSON 18 – ‘Traffic lights’.
A left-hand green arrow placed separately when crossing a crossroads means that the opposite traffic on the lane that leaves the drivers on the left will be held by a red light to facilitate clearing of the intersection.

q:
This sign says there are traffic lights (150 meters further).
This plate is ...

A. … a warning or danger sign.
B. … a sign concerning the priority.
e:
LESSON 18 – ‘Traffic lights’.
This danger or warning sign means traffic lights. Danger signs are placed 150 meters before a danger.

q:
The left and right lane are closed. There must be zip-merge.
Car B drives first. Who can drive next?

A. Car A on the middle lane.
B. Car C on the left lane.
e:
LESSON 2 – ‘The lanes’.
The car in the middle lane gives first priority to the car on the right lane and then priority to the car on the left lane. Then car A may drive.

q: A child must be less than (...) years to ride on a footpath within built-up areas.
e:
LESSON 3 – ‘The bicycle lane’.
In built-up area and outside built-up area: under the age of 10 years (31/05/2019).
Outside built-up areas, all the cyclists, except if there is a bike path is in their direction of travel.

q: Are the cars allowed to ride on the rush-hour lane?
e:
LESSON 4 – ‘The motorway’.
If a green arrow hangs above the rush-hour lane, cars may drive on that lane.

q:
This driver drives as far as possible to the left on his lane on the motorway.

A. It is allowed, when he stays on his lane.
B. He has to drive as far as possible to the right.
e:
LESSON 4 – ‘The motorway’.
You should drive on the right side of the roadway and as much as possible on the right side of your lane.

q:
What is the maximum speed limit for the blue car on this motorway?

A. 50 km/hour.
B. 90 km/hour.
C. 120 km/hour.
e:
LESSON 4 – ‘The motorway’.
The speed limit only applies to the bus lane.

q:
The pink car drives on the merging lane of a motorway.
Who has priority?

A. The pink car.
B. The white car.
e:
LESSON 4 – ‘The motorway’.
A driver who drives on the merging lane of a motorway, has to give way.

q:
There is a traffic jam. The grey car drives on the left lane on this motorway. A motorcycle wants to overtake between the left and the middle lane. Where should the car driver drive on the lane?

A. As far to the left as possible.
B. In the middle.
C. As far to the right as possible.
e:
LESSON 4 – ‘The motorway’.
In a queue motorcycles are allowed to ride:
. between the two left lanes of traffic.
. at a maximum speed of 20 km/hour faster than the other vehicles.
. and at a maximum speed of 50 km/hour.
So the grey car drives as far as possible to the left, to give place.

q:
You want to drive on to the motorway via the merging lane.

A. You accelerate as soon as possible on the merging lane.
B. You accelerate when you drive on the right lane.
e:
LESSON 4 – ‘The motorway’.
You have to accelerate as soon as possible on the merging lane.

q:
An accident on the motorway. The driver positions the red warning triangle. Where should the passengers stay?

A. In the car.
B. Behind the crash barriers.
C. On the hard shoulder.
e:
LESSON 4 – ‘The motorway’.
The safest place is behind the crash barriers.

q:
500 meters further is an exit.
Where do you ride on the exit?

A. At the beginning of the exit.
B. Approximately in the middle of the exit.
C. As far as possible at the end of the exit.
e:
LESSON 4 – ‘The motorway’.
At the beginning of the exit.

q:
Which car is properly parked in this residential area?

A. Only car 1.
B. Only car 2.
C. Car 1 and Car 2.
e:
LESSON 6 – ‘Special places’.
In a residential area, you may park left and right of your direction of travel on the indicated parking places.

q:
*** 5 points question ***

What is correct?
In a residential area ...

A. ... is the maximum speed limit 25 km/hour.
B. ... are cars allowed to park on the left and right of the direction of travel.
C. ... may pedestrians and cyclists use the full lane.
e:
[Violations of the 3th and 4th degree on our page Theory B: nr. 32]
LESSON 6 – ‘Special places’.
The maximum speed limit is 20 km/hour.
Only pedestrians may use the full road.

q:
Which of these signs relate to the Maximum Authorized Weight M.A.W. of a car?

A. Only 1 + 2.
B. 2 + 3 + 4.
C. Only 3 + 4.
e:
LESSON 9 – ‘M.A.W. and M.G.W.’.
Signs 1 relate to the M.G.W.
Signs 2 , 3 (okt 2022) , 4 : M.A.W.

q:
Which of these signs no longer exists since October 1ts, 2022.

A. 1 + 2.
B. 3.
C. 4.
e:
LESSON 9 – ‘M.A.W. and M.G.W.’.
Signs 1, 2 and 3 (since October 1st 2022) relate to the M.A.W.

q:
What is ‘autodelen’?

A. When multiple people use at the same a car to reach a destination.
B. Occasionally use a car, on pre-defined moments through reservation system.
e:
LESSON 9 – ‘M.A.W. and M.G.W.’.
People use the same car at a different time. You use the car when you need it. If you do not need the car, someone else can drive.

q:
You have a driving license B. You drive in a car with a M.A.W. of 2500 kg.
How much is the maximum M.A.W. of your trailer?

A. 500 kg.
B. 1000 kg.
C. 1500 kg.
e:
LESSON 9 – ‘M.A.W. and M.G.W.’.
If the M.A.W. of the trailer exceeds 750 kg, a license B is OK, provided that the M.A.W. of the vehicle (car + trailer) is not more than 3.5 ton.

q:
For material that cannot be taken apart, any load must carry a warning marker that projects more than (…) behind the car.

A. 1 meter.
B. 1,50 meter.
C. 3 meter.
e:
LESSON 10 – ‘The load and the passenger spaces’.
From 1 meter to 3 meters.

q:
The width of a vehicle and its load is maximum …?

A. 2,45 m.
B. 2,50 m.
C. 2,55 m.
e:
LESSON 10 – ‘The load and the passenger spaces’.
A vehicle along with his load should not be wider than 2.55 meters. If wider = "exceptional transport".
(Height: up to 4 m).

q:
- A diving license B allows to pull a trailer with a M.A.W. to (...) kg.

A. 750 kg.
B. 1200 kg.
C. 3500 kg.
e:
LESSON 10 – ‘The load and the passenger spaces’.
BUT when the M.A.W. of the trailer exceeds 750 kg, a license B is ok, provided that the M.A.W. of car and trailer together does not exceed 3.5 ton.
With a provisional driving license B you cannot pull a trailer.

q:
When the M.A.W. of the trailer exceeds 750 kg, a driving license B is ok, provided that the M.A.W. of the car and the trailer together does not exceed (…) ton.

A. 3500 kg of 3,5 ton.
B. 4250 kg of 4,25 ton.
C. 4350 kg of 4,35 ton.
e:
LESSON 10 – ‘The load and the passenger spaces’.
With a provisional driving license B you cannot pull a trailer.

q:
You have a provisional driving license B.
Can you pull a trailer with your car?
e:
LESSON 10 – ‘The load and the passenger spaces’.
With a provisional driving license B you cannot pull a trailer.

q:
*** 5 points question ***

A school bus has stopped and the hazard warning lights are being used. What do you have to do?

A. Stop.
B. Slow down and stop if necessary.
C. Drive on.
e:
[Violations of the 3th and 4th degree on our page Theory B: nr. 32]
LESSON 11 – ‘The lights’.
If a school bus stops so that students can go out, the driver has to switch on the four direction indicators or hazard warning lights.
Upcoming vehicles are obliged to reduce speed and if it is necessary to stop
They should be careful while driving by the bus.

q:
Heavy rainfall, but the visibility is enough.
The rear fog lights ...

A. ... must be switched on.
B. ... must be switched on when the spray from heavy rainfall makes it difficult to see other cars.
C. ... must not be switched on.
e:
LESSON 11 – ‘The lights’.
During heavy rain (in Belgium) they must be switched on.
(In The Netherlands absolutely not).

q:
There is heavy fog.
Should the front fog lights burn?

A. Yes.
B. No.
e:
LESSON 11- 'The lights’
The front fog lamps are not required on a car.
You are therefore never required to make them burn.

q: Is it allowed to turn on the four warning lights to alert the driver behind you that there is a traffic jam?
e:
LESSON 11- 'The lights’
You may only use the warning lights for signaling:
. a school bus with children during embarkation or disembarkation;
. a vehicle that is defective or immobilized after an accident;
. a dangerous situation as it suddenly slowing the vehicles before you.

q:
Is it allowed to give a warning signal with the horn of your car when you want to overtake another driver?

A. Yes, during the day outside built-up areas.
B. Yes, during the day in built-up areas.
C. Yes, always in built-up areas.
e:
LESSON 11- 'The lights’
Horn during the day:
. Inside and outside built-up areas: to warn others and thus to avoid an accident.
. Outside built-up areas: to warn a driver that you want to catch up.

q:
You're driving and there is heavy fog.
What lights are required to burn?

A. The front and rear fog lamps.
B. Only the front fog lamps.
C. Only the rear fog lamps.
e:
LESSON 11- 'The lights’
The front fog lamps are not required on a car.
You are therefore never required to make them burn.

q:
The speed of the car in front of you is 90 km/hour.
What is the safe following distance?

A. 45 meters.
B. 55 meters.
C. 65 meters.
e:
LESSON 13 – ‘The stopping distance’.
Via a simple formula, you can calculate that distance: the speed at which you drive, divided by two.

q:
You have to slow down.
Is it correct that the faster you drive, the longer the stopping distance will be?
e:
LESSON 13 – ‘The stopping distance’.
The faster you drive, the longer the stopping distance.

q:
The reaction time when you're tired …

A. ... increases.
B. ... remains the same.
e:
LESSON 13 – ‘The stopping distance’.
Because of fatigue, you will react more slowly to something.

q:
Two cars will cross each other on a dirt road.
How much lateral distance must be kept?

A. 1 meter.
B. 1.5 meters.
C. Sufficient.
e:
LESSON 14 – ‘Crossing’.
The traffic regulations don’t define 'how much' it must be. There is written: 'sufficient'.

q:
*** 5 points question ***

In this street, two cars want to cross each other.
How much lateral distance must be kept?

A. Sufficient.
B. 1,5 meters.
C. 1 meter.
e:
[Violations of the 3th and 4th degree on our page Theory B: nr. 32]
LESSON 14 – ‘Crossing’.
The traffic regulations don’t define 'how much' it must be. There is written: 'sufficient'.

q:
What is the meaning of this sign?

A. Give priority to drivers coming from the other direction
B. Traffic allowed in both direction, after first only one way direction.
e:
LESSON 14 – ‘Crossing’.
The sign that says that you should give priority, is a round sign with a red and black arrow.

q:
*** 5 points question ***

The blue car driver approaches the back of the agent.

A. He must stop.
B. He may turn to the right.
e:
[Violations of the 3th and 4th degree on our page Theory B: nr. 32]
LESSON 17 – ‘Qualified persons’.
If an officer has one or two arms stretched out horizontally, this is a stop signal for all traffic approaching from in front of or from behind the outstretched arms.

q:
*** 5 points question ***

What is the hierarchical order?

A. 1 - 2 - 3.
B. 3 - 2 - 1.
C. 3 - 1 - 2.
e:
[Violations of the 3th and 4th degree on our page Theory B: nr. 32]
LESSON 17 – ‘Qualified persons’.
At the top of the commands of an agent.
Then the traffic lights.
Than the road signs.
Then the traffic rules.

q:
You approach this junction and you want to cross it.
The oncoming car wants to turn left.
Do you have to give it priority?
e:
LESSON 21 – ‘Priority and changing directions’.
If the traffic lights work, the board under the lights has no meaning.
The traffic light is green, so you're allowed to drive straight through.
Your oncoming vehicle (if it also has green light), wants to turn and must want to give priority.

q:
You approach this junction and you want to cross it.
The oncoming car wants to turn left.
Do you have to give it priority?
e:
LESSON 21 – ‘Priority and changing directions’.
If the traffic lights work, the board under the lights has no meaning.
The traffic light is green, so you're allowed to drive straight through.
Your oncoming vehicle (if it also has green light), wants to turn left and must want to give priority.

q:
Who has priority?

A. The red car.
B. The white car.
e:
LESSON 21 – ‘Priority and changing directions’.
The red car who wants to turn right or makes the shortest turn, has priority.
The white car who wants to turn left, or makes the longest turn, has to give priority.

q:
Who has priority?

A. The red car.
B. The white car.
e:
LESSON 21 – ‘Priority and changing directions’.
The driver of the white car who wants to drive straight on has priority.
The driver who wants to turn left, has to give priority.

q:
At an intersection you want to turn left.
What do you do?

A. Slow down – Look in the mirror – Turn direction indicator.
B. Turn direction indicator – Look in the mirror – Slow down.
C. Look in the mirror – Turn direction indicator – Slow down.
e:
LESSON 21 – ‘Priority and changing directions’.
See if a car is coming behind you that you for example catches up. Turn Direction indicator on. Slowing down and turn.

q:
When there is a problem of the 'dead angle’?

A. Always.
B. Only if the mirrors are incorrectly adjusted.
e:
LESSON 21 – ‘Priority and changing directions’.
Mirrors must be always correctly adjusted before you drive.
But there is always a point that you can't see in the mirrors: the dead angle

q:
*** 5 points question ***

A crossroad without traffic signs.
In what situation the pedestrian has priority?

A. Only drawing A.
B. Only drawing B.
C. Drawing A + B.
e:
[Violations of the 3th and 4th degree on our page Theory B: nr. 32]
LESSON 21 – ‘Priority and changing directions’.
A car that changes direction, should give priority to pedestrians who cross the road where the car wants to go.

q:
*** 5 points question ***

An intersection with traffic signs.
In what situation the pedestrian has priority?

A. Only drawing A.
B. Only drawing B.
C. Drawing A + B.
e:
[Violations of the 3th and 4th degree on our page Theory B: nr. 32]
LESSON 21 – ‘Priority and changing directions’.
A car that changes direction, should give priority to pedestrians who cross the road where the car wants to go.

q:
Do you have priority at this junction?

A. Yes.
B. No.
e:
LESSON 20 – ‘Priority form the right’.
Each driver who comes from the right should have priority, even if he first stopped.

q:
Is the driver of the car at this junction allowed to overtake the moped on the left?

A. Yes, when it is safe.
B. Yes, when there is 1 meter space between them.
C. No.
e:
LESSON 20 – ‘Priority form the right’.
It’s forbidden to overtake on the left animals in harness, a vehicle with more than 2 wheels and a two-wheeled motor vehicle on intersections where the priority from the right applies.

q:
Who has priority?

A. The pedestrian.
B. The car.
e:
LESSON 20 – ‘Priority form the right’.
At this junction the priority of the right applies.
There is not a crosswalk for pedestrians.

q:
Who has priority?

A. The pedestrian.
B. The car.
e:
LESSON 20 – ‘Priority form the right’.
At this junction the priority of the right applies.
But there is a crosswalk for pedestrians.
(Learn very well in your book when there is not priority from the right.)

q:
Who is the first to cross the intersection?

A. The pedestrian.
B. The car.
e:
LESSON 19 – ‘Junction and traffic sign’.
The car must give priority to MANAGERS on the intersection.
A pedestrian is not a driver, but there is a crossroads for pedestrians.
Therefore the pedestrian is allowed to go first.

q:
Who is the first to cross the intersection?

A. The pedestrian.
B. The car.
e:
LESSON 19 – ‘Junction and traffic sign’.
A triangle on its tip means that you have to give way to the drivers (not the pedestrians) that run on the path you are going to take, and that you eventually have to stop. There is no pedestrian crossing.

q:
Who is the first to cross the intersection?

A. The pedestrian.
B. The car.
e:
LESSON 19 – ‘Junction and traffic sign’.
A STOP means that you must stop and give way to the drivers (not the pedestrians) that run on the track you are going to take
A pedestrian is not a driver and there is no pedestrian crossing.

q:
What is the safest distance between you and the vehicle in front of you when you stop?

A. When you can still see the license plate.
B. When you can still see the bumper or the exhaust pipe.
C. When you can still see the rear tyres.
e:
LESSON 25 – ‘Waiting and parking’.
You can still see the rear tyres.

q:
On which verge can you park within a built up area?

A. Only on the ground level verge.
B. Only on an elevated verge.
C. On a ground level or elevated verge.
e:
LESSON 25 – ‘Waiting and parking’.
Outside a built up area: on a ground level or elevated verge.

q:
On which verge can you park outside a built up area?

A. Only on the ground level verge.
B. Only on an elevated verge.
C. On a ground level or elevated verge.
e:
LESSON 25 – ‘Waiting and parking’.
Inside a built up area: on the ground level verge.
Outside a built up area: on a ground level or elevated verge.

q:
On a speed hump ...

A. ... you may only wait.
B. ... you may wait and park.
C. ... you may not wait and no park.
e: LESSON 25 – ‘Waiting and parking’.

q:
There is file. The car in front of you just drove over a speed hump and stops again.
Can you stop on the speed hump?
e:
LESSON 25 – ‘Waiting and parking’.
Just stop in a file because you cannot drive further, is not waiting or parking.
Only waiting and parking are prohibited on a speed hump.

q: On this express road In Wallonia with 2x2 lanes, a car is allowed to drive maximum (…) km/hour.
e:
LESSON 5 – ‘The express road’.
In Flanders: 70 kph unless traffic signs or rules impose a different speed limit.
In Wallonia and Brussels-capital region: 90 kph.

q:
You are approaching this intersection with your car.
Can you catch a two-wheeled motorcycle or moped at the crossroads on the left?

A. Yes.
B. Yes, if no drivers come from the right.
C. No.
e:
LESSON 20 – ‘Priority form the right’.
It’s forbidden to overtake on the left animals in harness, a vehicle with more than 2 wheels and a two-wheeled motor vehicle on intersections where the priority from the right applies.

q:
The driver of the blue car wants to turn right.

A. He takes the first right-hand lane (1).
B. He takes the second right-hand lane (2).
C. He can choose between the first or second lane.
e:
LESSON 21 – ‘Priority and changing directions’.
In a build-up area, he can choose the lane he wants to drive on.

q: This sign means that you should be careful when changing direction, because cyclists and riders of two-wheeled mopeds follow the same public road.
e:
LESSON 3 – ‘The bicycle lane’.
This sign means that you should be careful when changing direction, because cyclists and riders of two-wheeled mopeds follow the same public road.

q:
*** 5 points question ***

Your girlfriend lives in this pedestrian zone.
Can you drive your car to her home?
e:
[Violations of the 3th and 4th degree on our page Theory B: nr. 32]
LESSON 7 – ‘The pedestrians’.
No, that is not allowed.

q:
Beyond these signs, a child wants to cross the street in a place where is no pedestrian crossing.
Do you need to stop and give priority to the child?
e:
LESSON 7 – ‘The pedestrians’.
A pedestrian who wants to cross the roadway in a place where there is no pedestrian crossing should itself give priority. However, the message is that you should always be careful.

q:
How do you react when you see a scared horse on the way?

A. Simply continue driving.
B. Delay.
C. Stopping.
e:
LESSON 8 – ‘The drivers’.
Every driver should immediately slow down when approaching pulling animals, welding, driving or livestock on public roads. He had to stop if these animals show signs of fear.

q:
What is car sharing?

A. With several people at the same time use the car to reach a destination together.
B. Occasionally using a car at times fixed in advance via reservation system.
e:
LESSON 9 – ‘M.A.W. and M.G.W.’.
If you share a car, you use one car with several people at a different time. You use the car when you need it. When you don't need it, someone else can drive it. In this way, a car is used better and thoughtfully and not everyone has to buy a car.

q:
You are in possession of a driving licence B. You drive in a car with a M.A.W. of 2500 kg.
How much is the maximum M.A.W. your trailer can have?

A. 500 kg.
B. 1000 kg.
C. 1500 kg.
e:
LESSON 9 – ‘M.A.W. and M.G.W.’.
As the M.A.W. of the trailer is more than 750 kg, a driving licence B shall be sufficient provided that the M. A.W. of the assembly (car + trailer) does not exceed 3500 kg.

q:
*** 5 points question ***

The barriers are still fully open, but the alarm signal is clearly audible.

*** 5 points question ***

[Violations of the 3th and 4th degree on our page Theory B: nr. 32]
LESSON 18 – ‘Traffic lights’.
Orange says you have to stop. Except if you are too close to the intersection, and you put the driver behind you at risk.

Which cars may be parked beyond?

LESSON 27 – ‘Waiting and parking’.
Only electric cars.

q:
Should you ask the police to come in case of an accident with only material damage?

A. Yes, always.
B. No, except if the parties do not agree.
C. No, never.

LESSON 29 - 'Accident'.
Always when there are injured.
If there is only material damage, then not. Unless the parties do not agree and do not want to sign the collision form.

You release the respiratory tract and, if necessary, take vomit from the mouth.

q:
You have driven against a tank car at the back.

A. It is sufficient to complete a European collision form.
B. Call the number 112.

LESSON 29 - 'Accident'.
Although there are no injuries, call 112, because chemicals can be very dangerous.

q: Do you also have to write down the street names on the situation sketch?

LESSON 29 - 'Accident'.
the road situation;
. the direction of travel of the vehicles;
. the position of the vehicles at the time of impact;
. the road signs (lights, signs, lines);
. the street names (or roads).

A. Yes.
B. No, if you have a hands-free kit.
C. No, because you don't talk to anyone on the mobile phone.
e: LESSON 1

q:
Which vehicles are allowed to drive past these signs?

A. Cyclists only.
B. Only cyclists and mopeds class A.
C. Cyclists, mopeds class A and (speed) pedelecs.
Are you allowed to turn around, on the checker-board markings at an intersection?
e: LESSON 22 - 'Train - tram- bus'.

q: Can you overtake a speed pedelec with your car in a bicycle street?
e: LESSON 3 – ‘The bicycle lane’.

q:
From how many cyclists in a group are these cyclists not obliged to ride on the bicycle lane?

A. From 10.
B. From 15.
C. From 20.
e: LESSON 3

q:
What is the maximum speed allowed for this car?

A. Maximum 70 km/h.
B. Maximum 90 km/h.
Can you overtake a speed pedelec on a bicycle street?
e: LESSON 3

q:
When is a car the most environmentally friendly?

A. With a high eco-score.
B. With a low eco-score.
e:
LESSON 30 – “Environment”.
Eco-score is expressed with a number between 1 and 100.
The higher, the more environmentally friendly.

q:
You parked your car in this street at night.
The next day it is a play street (or school street).
Can you leave this street with your car?
e:
LESSON 6 - "Special places".
At certain times you are not allowed to enter this street.
But you can drive away with your car.

q:
I am driving my car in a bicycle zone.
A moped class A is driving in front of me at 20 km/h.
Am I allowed to overtake the moped?
e: You are not allowed to overtake a cyclist (or equivalent) or a speed pedelec.

q:
What is the maximum speed you are allowed to drive past these signs?

A. 50 km/h.
B. 30 km/h.
Can you overtake a cyclist on the left with a car on an elevated section?
e: For years, it has been allowed to overtake a cyclist on the right who is about to turn left. Since 2023, overtaking a cyclist on the left is also allowed.

q: Can you overtake a cyclist on the right with a car on an elevated section?
e: For years, it has been allowed to overtake a cyclist on the right who is about to turn left. Since 2023, overtaking a cyclist on the left is also allowed.

q:
In Flanders, the maximum permitted speed on a central lane roadway outside built-up areas is 70 kilometers per hour.
How much is that speed in Wallonia?

A. 90 kilometers per hour.
B. Also 70 kilometers per hour.
e: In Belgium: 70km/h.

q:
Where are you allowed to overtake a moped on the left at an intersection?

A. On a priority road.
B. On a road with priority from the right.
C. On a priority road and a road with priority from the right.
e: LESSON 16

q:
What influence does too high tire pressure have on the road position?

A. The car is better positioned on the road.
B. The car is worse positioned on the road.
C. The tire pressure has no effect on this.

The barriers are already open, but the red light is still on.
Can I cross the crossing already?
e: You are not allowed to drive onto the level crossing as long as the red flashing light is on, even if the barriers are open.

q:
What does E5 refer to?

A. The octane content of the petrol.
B. The added bio-ethanol.
e: Since 2019, fuel is primarily designated by a name that indicates the maximum amount of bioethanol mixed in. Bioethanol is an alcohol made by fermenting sugar, corn or wheat. This is therefore a form of renewable energy.

q:
What is the maximum speed you are allowed to drive on a motorway with studded tyres?

A. Maximum 70 kph.
B. Maximum 90 kph.
C. Maximum 100 kph.
e: On a ordinary road: 60 kph.

q:
What is the maximum speed you are allowed to drive with studded tires on a regular road?

A. Maximum 60 kph.
B. Maximum 70 kph.
C. Maximum 90 kph.
e: On a motorway: 90 kph.

q:
Which statement is correct about the speed on the motorway?

A. you should always drive at least 70 kph.
B. you should always drive 120 kph.
C. you should adjust the speed to the circumstances.
Do backseat passengers also have to wear a seat belt?
Are tow trucks allowed to drive in the closed lane on their way to an accident?

A winged zebra crossing.
Who is allowed to cross here?

A. Only pedestrians.
B. Pedestrians and cyclists.

What is the meaning of this sign?

A. Emergency stop.
B. Rescue lane.
C. Refuge.

Is the braking distance shorter or longer when driving on snow?

A. Shorter.
B. Longer.
C. Makes no difference.
e: When driving on snow, the braking distance can be up to four times longer.

q:
The red light is already on, but the barrier is still open.
Are you allowed to drive further?

A. Yes, but carefully.
B. No, you must stop.
e: Red light and bell sound means stop, even if the barrier is still open.

q:
You drive on this public road. You want to set up your GPS.
Where can you stop?

A. On the roadway.
B. On the side lane.
C. You are not allowed to stop.
e: You are not allowed to stop on the middle lane (roadway) and on the side lane

q:
At what speed limit can you drive on a central carriageway in the Walloon region?

A. 30 km/h.
B. 70 km/h.
C. 90 km/h.
e: 70 km/h throughout the country.

q:
From how many people must a group of cyclists be accompanied by at least 2 supervisors?

A. More than 15 cyclists.
B. More than 25 cyclists.
C. More than 50 cyclists.
e: From 51 cyclists.

q:
A motorway with three lanes in your direction of travel.
Between which lanes can a motorcycle ride when there is a traffic jam?

A. Between lane 1 and 2.
B. Between lane 2 and 3.
C. He can choose.

The Euro norm

A. The higher the better for the environment.
B. The lower the better for the environment.

The ABS light is on. What do you do?

A. You have to stop immediately, because you have no brakes anymore.
B. You drive on, but you have it checked at the garage.
C. You pull the fuse, so that the light stops burning.
e: An ABS light on your car’s dashboard means there is an issue with the car’s anti-lock braking system. The Anti-lock Braking System &#40;ABS&#41; is a safety system that prevents the wheels of a vehicle from locking up when braking, and this warning tells you that the system is not working as intended. The ABS light is usually an amber, yellow, or orange light that spells out “ABS” and turns on during startup for a few seconds. If the ABS light stays on, then you might be dealing with a faulty ABS control module, low brake fluid levels, and a faulty wheel speed sensor.

q:
Semi-monthly alternating parking.
What do you have to take into account?

A. Only with the date.
B. With the date and with the house numbers.
Your car is broken down. Is your friend allowed to tow your car on the highway?

A carriageway with 2x2 lanes within a built-up area.
Are you allowed to drive in the left lane?

What is the maximum speed you can drive on a motorway with studded tires?

A. 70 km/h.
B. 90 km/h.
C. 100 km/h.

The traffic light is red.
Can you read messages on your cell phone while you wait?

You have an accident with a cyclist, who stays on the street and no longer moves.
What do you do first?

A. Call the ambulance.
B. Moving the car.
C. Install the warning triangle.

Where can you park under a bridge?

A. Only on the roadway.
B. Only on the ground verge.
C. You are not allowed to park.

You have parked your car.
Can you send a message with your mobile phone?

You stop during the practical exam to get out but you don't put on the handbrake.

A. The instructor doesn't mind.
B. You must retake the exam.
Do you have to turn on the indicator on a motorway entrance?
e: Anyone entering a motorway via the approach lane must switch on the indicator and give way to drivers already driving on the motorway. This also means that in case of heavy traffic on the acceleration lane, there is NO ZIPPING.

q:
Who has priority?

A. You.
B. The orange car.

You see this traffic sign.
Are you allowed to park a mobile home?

You see this traffic sign.
Are you allowed to park a motorcycle?
A solid yellow line on the edge of the lane means that you can park your car there.

There is stationary traffic on the motorway.
Can you drive on the hard shoulder the last few meters before an exit?

A. The last 150 meters.
B. The last 50 meters.
C. No.
e: You are not allowed to drive on a hard shoulder.

q:
Two cars on a central lane want to pass each other.
Which car should drive on the lateral strip to make the crossing possible?

A. The yellow car.
B. The red car.
C. the two cars.
e: LESSON 14

q: Are you allowed to hold your mobile phone in the car while waiting at a red traffic light?
e: Even when stopped at a red light, you are still considered a road user and are not allowed to hold or use a mobile phone, unless it is placed in a holder designed for that purpose.

q: Are you allowed to hold your mobile phone in the car while waiting at a red traffic light?
e: Even when stopped at a red light, you are still considered a road user and are not allowed to hold or use a mobile phone, unless it is placed in a holder designed for that purpose.

q:
You are driving your car in a bicycle zone.
Are you allowed to overtake a step?
e:
In a bicycle zone, motor vehicles are not allowed to overtake cyclists or users of mobility devices (such as electric steps), even if there is enough space.
The maximum speed is limited to 30 km/h.

q:
How long is a Belgian driving licence in bank card format valid?

A. 1 year.
B. 5 years.
C. 10 years.
e:
LESSON 1
A Belgian driving licence in bank card format is valid for 10 years. After 10 years, you must renew it at your local municipality, without having to retake the exam.

q:
Is there a medicine to reduce the alcohol concentration in the blood?

A. Yes, a doctor can prescribe one.
B. Yes, it is available in a pharmacy.
C. No, such a medicine does not exist.
e: LESSON 28

q:
Where must the reflective safety vest be located?

A. Inside the interior of the car.
B. In the trunk of the car.
e:
LESSON 4 - 'Motorway'
The reflective safety vest, also known as the yellow vest, must be located inside the vehicle’s interior, within easy reach, and not in the trunk. It is recommended to store it in the glove compartment, under the driver’s seat, or in a door pocket so that it is immediately accessible to the driver if they need to exit the vehicle on a motorway or a road for motor vehicles.

q:
The car in front of you wants to turn left.
There is no cyclist on the cycle path next to you.
Are you allowed to drive on the cycle path to pass the car on the right?
e:
LESSON 3 - 'Cyclists'
The cycle path is not part of the roadway.
You are not allowed to drive your car on it.

q:
Which road sign indicates a narrowing of the roadway to the right?

A. Sign 1.
B. Sign 2.
e:
LESSON 2 – 'Traffic Lanes'.
Sign 1: Danger sign.
Sign 2: Sign indicating a narrowing having the importance of a traffic lane.

q:
The police ask for your driving licence during a check.

A. You must always carry the original driving licence with you.
B. You have 24 hours to present the original driving licence.
e:
LESSON 9
If you are driving, you must have your original driver's license with you.

q:
What should you do if you notice an oil leak under your car?

A. Continue driving until the next service.
B. Go to a garage as soon as possible.
C. Check the oil level before every trip and add oil if needed.
e:
LESSON 31
An oil leak can cause serious engine damage. Even if you top up the oil regularly, the leak remains dangerous. You must have the leak repaired in a garage as soon as possible.

q:
The four digits following the word DOT on the sidewall of a tire indicate the tire’s production date.

A. The first two digits show the week, and the last two the year.
B. The first two digits show the year, and the last two the week.
C. The four digits have nothing to do with the production date.
e:
LESSON 31
The DOT code includes a 4-digit number: the first two digits indicate the week of manufacture, and the last two indicate the year. For example, 3519 means the tire was made in week 35 of 2019.

q:
A shepherd walking on the road with his sheep is...

A. A pedestrian.
B. A driver.
e: In the road code, he is considered a driver.

q:
There is heavy traffic on the motorway entrance ramp.
When are you allowed to merge?

A. You may merge as soon as it is safe to do so.
B. You must follow the cars in front of you to the end of the ramp before merging.
e:
LESSON 4
The zipper principle does not apply when entering a motorway.
So you do not have to drive to the end of the ramp before merging.
You may merge wherever it is safe to do so.

q:
You drive past this sign.
Are you allowed to overtake a motorcycle on the left here?
e:
LESSON 22
The sign is placed 150 meters before the level crossing. You are driving on a regular roadway here.

q:
To whom must I show my ID card in the event of an accident?

A. To all persons involved in the accident if they ask, and to the qualified officer.
B. Only to the qualified officer.
e:
LESSON 29
In the event of an accident involving only material damage and if you are over 15 years old, you must present your identity card to the other people involved if they request it. In the case of injuries or serious damage, the authorities may also require it.

q:
I answer a call with my phone mounted on a support.

A. There is no risk.
B. I must stay extra alert and vigilant.
e:
LESSON 29
The support does not eliminate potential distractions. You need to stay focused on the traffic.

q:
In which direction should a car's wheels be turned if the driver wants to turn left, but the intersection is not yet clear?

A. To the left.
B. Straight ahead.
e: LESSON 21

q:
When is it allowed to drive on the peak-hour lane if there is no green arrow above it?

A. You may not drive on it.
B. It is allowed to exit or enter the road.
e: LESSON 4

q:
Must you use the left indicator when you're already properly positioned to turn left?

A. Yes, always, and turn it off as soon as the manoeuvre is completed.
B. No, because you're already well positioned.
e:
LESSON 21
A turn signal is there to indicate your intentions, even if you are already in the right position.

q:
An intersection without traffic lights or priority signs.
Is the blue car allowed to overtake a two-wheeled moped on the left?

A. Yes.
B. No.
e:
LESSON 16
This is an intersection where the priority-to-the-right rule applies.
At this type of intersection, the car is only allowed to overtake a cyclist on the left.

q:
You are on a motorway entrance ramp, but you forgot to start your GPS.
Can you stop behind the white line?

A. I can stop behind the white line because I am not yet on the motorway.
B. I cannot stop behind the white line because I am already on the motorway.
e:
LESSON 4
The entrance ramp is part of the motorway. Stopping or parking on the ramp is prohibited.

q:
The moon-white light is on at this level crossing with double tracks.
Which vehicles are you allowed to overtake on the left if it's safe?

A. Only cyclists and similar road users.
B. Only cyclists and two-wheeled mopeds.
C. All vehicles.
e:
LESSON 16
As long as the red lights are not flashing, you may approach the level crossing.
When the red lights flash alternately, you must stop and you are not allowed to enter the level crossing.

q:
What does this traffic sign mean?

A. You are approaching a tram stop.
B. Tram tracks are located on the roadway.
e:
LESSON 1
This is a warning sign.
Watch out for trams, which always have priority.

q:
Fill in a number.
After which traffic sign are you driving on a priority road?
e:
LESSON 19
Sign 2 means you are on a priority road. You have priority at all intersections until the sign is cancelled or another sign changes the priority.
Sign 1 gives you priority only at the next intersection.
Sign 3 says nothing about priority; it only means traffic flows in one direction.
Sign 4 simply indicates a direction you must follow, not priority.

q:
Being stationary to pick up or drop off people is allowed...

A. … only at a bus stop.
B. … only at a bus stop and on a bus lane.
C. … at a bus stop, on a bus lane, and on a special reserved route.
e:
LESSON 22
You are only allowed to stop at a bus stop to let someone get in or out of the vehicle.

q:
You are not allowed to overtake that car at this intersection.
But who are you allowed to overtake?

A. Only a cyclist.
B. Only a cyclist and a class A moped.
C. A cyclist, a class A moped, and a motorcycle.
e:
LESSON 16
At an intersection where the priority-to-the-right rule applies, you may only overtake a cyclist and similar users, such as an electric scooter, on the left.

q:
Are you allowed to stop on a motorway at this sign to send an urgent message?

A. Yes.
B. No.
e:
LESSON 4
On a motorway, you may only stop on an emergency bay if your vehicle breaks down or in case of a real emergency. Sending a message, even an urgent one, is not a valid reason. Stopping without a justified reason is dangerous and prohibited.

q:
Zipper merging is required. Where should you merge?

A. As soon as possible.
B. As soon as it is safe.
C. Just before the lane ends.
e:
LESSON 2
Zipper merging is mandatory when a lane disappears and traffic is heavily slowed down or stopped (like in a traffic jam). You must merge just before the disappearing lane ends.
When entering a motorway, zipper merging is not used—instead, you must give priority to drivers already on the motorway.

q:
A yellow broken line at the edge of the carriageway.
This car may stop to let someone get out.
But is the driver also allowed to park there?
e:
LESSON 26
When a yellow broken line is painted at the edge of the carriageway, you may only stop.
Parking on the carriageway is prohibited.

q: Outside a built-up area, must you give way to a bus leaving a bus stop?
e:
LESSON 22
You must give way inside a built-up area. You must never give way to a coach leaving a bus stop.

q:
May you use the horn at night in case of imminent danger?

A. Yes, you may.
B. No, at night you should rather flash your high beams.
e:
LESSON 11
Only in case of imminent danger, such as when a car suddenly changes lanes, you may use the horn at night.

q:
You are approaching this intersection. Where must you stop?

A. Just before the stop line.
B. 1 metre before the stop line.
C. Just before the STOP sign.
e:
LESSON 19
You must always come to a complete stop when there is a STOP sign, even if there are no other road users. You stop just before the stop line. If there is no stop line, you stop level with the STOP sign. You must give way to other drivers on the road you intend to enter.

q:
In a van, there is a front seat where the driver and two passengers can sit. What is the minimum required width of that seat?

A. 125 cm.
B. 130 cm.
C. 135 cm.
e:
LESSON 10
The width must be enough for:
Driver: 55 cm.
Each passenger: 40 cm.
Total: 55 + 40 + 40 = 135 cm.

q:
You damaged another car while parking. You don’t know who the owner is.
How much time do you have to report it at a police station?

A. 12 hours.
B. 24 hours.
C. As soon as possible.
e:
LESSON 29
If you damage someone’s property and the police cannot come to the scene, you must report it as soon as possible at a police station or online via Police-on-Web (for minor damage). The sooner you report it, the more likely it is that the facts will be correctly recorded. Make sure you have all necessary information, such as the location and time of the incident, the license plate of the damaged vehicle, and photos of the damage.

q:
Are you allowed to overtake the motorcycle on the left at this intersection?

A. Yes.
B. Yes, if you leave sufficient lateral distance.
C. No.
e:
LESSON 16
At intersections where no traffic signs regulate priority, or where this road sign is present and therefore the priority to the right applies, it is forbidden to overtake on the left:
a vehicle with a trailer,
a vehicle with more than two wheels,
or a motor vehicle with two wheels.
A cyclist is not a motor vehicle, so you are allowed to overtake them. You may also overtake a personal mobility device.

q:
Are you allowed to overtake the motorcycle on the left at this intersection?

A. Yes.
B. Yes, if you leave sufficient lateral distance.
C. No.
e:
LESSON 16
At intersections where no traffic signs regulate priority, or where this road sign is present and therefore the priority to the right applies, it is forbidden to overtake on the left:
a vehicle with a trailer,
a vehicle with more than two wheels,
or a motor vehicle with two wheels.
A cyclist is not a motor vehicle, so you are allowed to overtake them. You may also overtake a personal mobility device.

q: Are these two vehicles crossing each other in the correct way?
e:
LESSON 14
Vehicles must cross each other on the right. Only if arrows on the roadway indicate that they must cross on the left, is this of course allowed.

q: Are these two vehicles crossing each other in the correct way?
e:
LESSON 14
Vehicles must cross each other on the right. Only if arrows on the roadway indicate that they must cross on the left, is this of course allowed.

q:
Enter a number:
After which sign do you not expect cars coming from the opposite direction?
e:
1. You have priority at the next intersection.
2. You have priority at the next intersections.
3. One-way street.
4. Mandatory direction.

q:
Is a pedestrian (orange arrow) allowed to cross the road at that place?

A. Yes.
B. No, he must use the pedestrian crossing.
e:
LESSON 7
The traffic sign indicates that there is a pedestrian crossing 100 meters ahead.
A pedestrian must use it if they are within 20 meters of the crossing.
That is not the case here.

q:
Fill in a number.
Which traffic sign has the same meaning as a green light?
e:
LESSON 18
(1) An inverted triangle has the same meaning as a green light.
(2) A circle has the same meaning as a steady amber light.
(3) A horizontal bar has the same meaning as a red light.
(4) A diagonal bar pointing left allows driving only in that direction.

q:
Fill in a number.
Which traffic sign has the same meaning as a red light?
e:
LESSON 18
(1) An inverted triangle has the same meaning as a green light.
(2) A circle has the same meaning as a steady amber light.
(3) A horizontal bar has the same meaning as a red light.
(4) A diagonal bar pointing left allows driving only in that direction.

q:
Fill in a number.
Which traffic sign has the same meaning as a steady amber light?
e:
LESSON 18
(1) An inverted triangle has the same meaning as a green light.
(2) A circle has the same meaning as a steady amber light.
(3) A horizontal bar has the same meaning as a red light.
(4) A diagonal bar pointing left allows driving only in that direction.

q:
Are you allowed to overtake the motorcycle on the left at this intersection?

A. Yes.
B. Yes, if you leave sufficient lateral distance.
C. No.
e:
LESSON 16
At intersections where you have priority, you may overtake other drivers on the left.
- Priority at the next intersection.
- Priority road.
- Green traffic light.

q:
Beyond which traffic sign must you drive at least 70 km/h, if conditions allow?

A. Beyond sign 1.
B. Beyond sign 2.
C. Beyond sign 1 and 2.
e:
LESSON 5
Only on a motorway (sign 1) does a minimum speed of 70 km/h apply, if conditions allow. On an express road (sign 2), this obligation does not exist.

q:
Beyond which traffic sign must you drive at least 70 km/h, if conditions allow?

A. Beyond sign 1.
B. Beyond sign 2.
C. Beyond sign 1 and 2.
e:
LESSON 5
Only on a motorway (sign 1) does a minimum speed of 70 km/h apply, if conditions allow. On an express road (sign 2), this obligation does not exist.

q:
The police can ask any driver to take a breath test.
Is that also the case for a saliva test?

A. Yes, a saliva test can be imposed on any driver.
B. Yes, if there is, based on objective findings, a suspicion of drug use.
e:
LESSON 28
In Belgium, there is zero tolerance for drugs in traffic. The police regularly carry out drug checks to determine whether you have certain prohibited substances in your body.
But a saliva test may only be carried out if the police suspect that you are under the influence of drugs, and this suspicion must be based on objective findings.

q:
The barrier of this level crossing is open and no bell is ringing.
However, the lights are out of order.
Are you allowed to overtake a moped on the left?

A. Yes.
B. No.
e:
LESSON 16
At level crossings indicated by this sign, overtaking on the left is prohibited for: a horse-drawn vehicle; a vehicle with more than two wheels; or a two-wheeled motor vehicle, except when barriers are present or when the lunar white light is on.

q:
On this road marking that indicates a bus stop, you may drive.
But what else are you allowed to do?

A. Wait.
B. Wait and park.
e:
LESSON 22
You are not allowed to park on the road marking that indicates a bus stop.
If there is no road marking but only a sign indicating the bus stop, you may not park within 15 meters before and after that sign.

q:
What is the maximum permitted speed within a built-up area in the Walloon Region when passing the sign indicating a pedestrian crossing?

A. Maximum 20 km/h.
B. Maximum 30 km/h.
C. Maximum 50 km/h.
e:
LESSON 6
The sign indicating a pedestrian crossing does not set a speed limit.
Within built-up areas:
- Flanders and Wallonia: maximum 50 km/h.
- Brussels Region: maximum 30 km/h.

q:
Must a cyclist also give priority to pedestrians on a pedestrian crossing?

A. Yes.
B. No, only drivers of motor vehicles.
e:
LESSON 7
All drivers must give priority to pedestrians on a pedestrian crossing. A cyclist is also considered a driver.

q:
One-way street.
Are speedpedelecs also allowed to ride in the opposite direction?
e:
The vehicles mentioned on the traffic sign and allowed to ride in the opposite direction are:
- buses.
- class A mopeds.
- speedpedelecs.
- bicycles.

q:
A one-way street.
The additional sign indicates that cyclists and class A mopeds may ride in the opposite direction.
e: The additional sign indicates that only cyclists may ride in the opposite direction.

q: Does the sign that ends all local prohibitions also put an end to parking signs?
e:
LESSON 26
The sign with a black diagonal stripe informs road users of the end of all regulations previously indicated by signs, except those concerning stopping and parking.

q:
The windshield washer reservoir is empty. This may negatively affect the driver’s visibility.
What should you do?

A. Stop immediately and refill.
B. Drive to the nearest garage.
C. Refill as soon as possible.
e:
LESSON 31
If you hear a humming or buzzing sound when you activate the washer but no liquid sprays onto the windshield, the reservoir is empty. You should refill it as soon as possible, because without washer fluid your visibility can be greatly reduced, especially in rain or when dirt splashes up from the road. Just like engine oil, the washer fluid level should be checked regularly.

q:
The photo is taken from the car you are driving.
You want to turn right at the intersection.
Are you allowed to drive here on the bus lane?

A. No.
B. Yes, it is allowed.
C. Here, you must do it.
e:
LESSON 2
When approaching an intersection, you drive on the bus lane if you want to turn right.

q:
Inside a built-up area in the Walloon Region.
At what maximum speed are you allowed to pass this sign?

A. Walking pace.
B. 30 km/h.
C. 50 km/h.
e:
LESSON 12
The sign is placed at a raised roadway feature.
You may cross it at a maximum speed of 30 km/h.

q:
The photo is taken from the car you are driving.
Who has the right of way?

A. You.
B. The white truck.
e:
LESSON 20
There is no police officer, no traffic lights, and no signs regulating priority. Therefore, the right-hand priority rule applies at the intersection.

q:
You are approaching this intersection. What does the traffic sign mean?

A. An intersection.
B. An intersection where drivers coming from the right must yield.
C. You must yield to drivers coming from the right.
e:
LESSON 20
The traffic sign indicates that this is an intersection where the priority-to-the-right rule applies.

q:
This prohibition sign applies to:

A. Only trucks.
B. Only trucks and coaches.
C. All types of vehicles.
e:
LESSON 10
Access prohibited to drivers of vehicles or vehicle combinations whose total length, including load, exceeds the length indicated.

q:
The train has already passed.
Are you allowed to drive on while the barriers are still rising?
e:
LESSON 18
You may only cross the level crossing when the barriers are fully raised and the white moonlight signal is on.

q:
Fill in a number.
After which sign do you have priority?
e:
LESSON 19
1. Priority to the right.
2. Road works.
3. Two-way traffic.
4. Priority at a road narrowing.

q:
You want to turn right at this intersection.
Do you have priority?
e:
LESSON 19
The priority sign indicates that you have priority at this intersection. The blue supplementary sign indicates that the priority road bends to the right.

q:
What does the yellow sign mean?

A. You must give way at the next intersection.
B. You have priority at the first upcoming intersection.
C. You are driving on a priority road.
e:
LESSON 19
The yellow priority sign means that you are driving on a priority road.
This means you have priority at the following intersections, until you see the sign “End of priority road”.

q:
You are not allowed to park on the roadway under a bridge, but you may park on the shoulder if there is one.
But are you allowed to stop on the roadway to let someone get out?
e:
LESSON 25
Both parking and waiting on the roadway under a bridge are prohibited.

q: Does this white car have priority at the intersection?
e:
LESSON 19
Before the intersection, there is a sign: End of priority road.

q:
You want to turn right at this intersection.
You slow down and, if necessary, you stop to give way to …

A. All road users.
B. All drivers.
e:
LESSON 19
The priority sign indicates that you must give way to drivers on the crossing road.
If necessary, stop before the inverted triangles on the road surface, also called shark’s teeth.

q:
This car has stopped because the traffic light is red.
